summary:
We need to produce JSON with keys: summary, business_intent, keywords (list). Must not list method names verbatim. Focus on class responsibility and state/behavior. Provide English description.

Class Solution: iterative model solution for MODFLOW 6. Handles solving multiple models (same type) with convergence criteria, iteration limits, linear solver settings, under-relaxation, backtracking, preconditioning, scaling, reordering, printing, CSV output, PTC control, ATS integration, validation. Provides methods to add/remove models, get list.

So summary: class configures and runs iterative solution for groundwater flow or transport models, managing convergence parameters and solver options.

Business intent: enable users to set up and execute robust numerical solution of MODFLOW 6 models, with preset configurations for simple/moderate/complex, allowing customization of nonlinear/linear iteration tolerances, acceleration, relaxation, preconditioning, output control, and integration with adaptive time stepping.

Keywords: iterative solver, groundwater modeling, MODFLOW 6, convergence criteria, nonlinear iterations, linear iterations, preconditioning, under-relaxation, backtracking, adaptive time stepping, CSV output, pseudo-transient continuation, model management.

 "summary": "...",
 "business_intent": "...",
 "keywords": [...]

Make sure no extra spaces? fine.

assistantfinal{{"summary":"The class configures and runs an iterative numerical solution for MODFLOW‑6 models, handling a collection of flow or transport models of the same type. It encapsulates convergence tolerances, iteration limits, linear acceleration, under‑relaxation schemes, backtracking, preconditioner settings, matrix scaling/reordering, output options, pseudo‑transient continuation control, and adaptive‑time‑step interaction, while providing helpers to add, remove, and query the models in the solution.", "business_intent":"Provide a flexible, validated interface that lets modelers define and execute robust iterative solvers for groundwater simulations, offering preset and fine‑tuned settings to achieve convergence efficiently across simple to complex scenarios, while supporting diagnostics, reporting, and integration with adaptive time‑stepping workflows.", "keywords":["iterative solver","groundwater modeling","MODFLOW 6","convergence criteria","nonlinear iterations","linear iterations","preconditioning","under‑relaxation","backtracking","adaptive time stepping","CSV output","pseudo‑transient continuation","model
